intent_atoms.description: Use a dedicated Release Readiness Runbook document (Documentation/ISOInspector.docc/Guides/ReleaseReadinessRunbook.md) as the canonical playbook for QA, distribution, and communications.
Provide a documented release checklist and go‑live runbook that covers QA gates, documentation deliverables, packaging steps, shared distribution metadata, Tuist manifests, and notarization tooling.

The Release Readiness Runbook must include: 1) QA gates, 2) documentation deliverables, 3) packaging steps tied to shared distribution metadata, Tuist manifests, and notarization tooling; 4) go/no‑go evidence requirements; 5) post‑release bookkeeping that keeps workplan, PRD TODO, and next‑task trackers synchronized.
The Release Readiness Runbook must be the single source of truth for release playbooks and must remain in sync with the distribution metadata, Tuist manifests, and notarization tooling.
Validate Markdown formatting using scripts/fix_markdown.py and Markdownlint before committing documentation changes.
Schedule macOS UI automation and Combine benchmarks when hardware is available and attach evidence to the release QA log.
Evidence from macOS UI automation and Combine benchmarks must be attached to the release QA log.
Evaluate hosted DocC publishing so that release artifacts are discoverable beyond GitHub Releases.
